intro: Rochefortia fasciculata, commonly known as the narrowleaf rochefortia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Rochefortia fasciculata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
